intro: Arnicratea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty arnica, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy, reddish-brown stems and yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in alpine and subalpine regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, rusty-colored hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The species is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
